content: as est above bind off all sts in rib-pattern break and secure yarn 7 the right sleeve start by overlapping the buttonhole-band and button-band with rs facing place the buttonhole-band of the back on top of the button-band of the front so that they lie completely on top of each other towards the armhole-opening it is important that the buttonhole-band comes on top you may secure the placement with a safety pin or a few sts using a contrasting yarn when picking up sts across the button-bands they should be picked up and knit through the 2 layers proceed in the same way as for left sleeve the shoulder join is the centre of the buttonhole-band finishing turn the sweater inside-out weave in loose ends from ws from rs sew the buttons along the button-band to match the opposite buttonholes wash and block the sweater into measurements taking care to follow the washing instructions of your yarn 8 the leggings sizes new-born / 3 months / 6 9 months circumference of waist 40/44/50 cm = 16/17 5/20 this is before inserting the elastic ribbon circumference at widest point below the waist 44/47 5/55 5 cm = 17 25/18 75/21 75 length of legs 14/18/22 cm = 5 5/7/9 the sample is worked in the newborn size knitting instructions the leggings are worked top-down starting from the waist-line where you insert the elastic band the main-body in stripe-pattern is worked in the round work is split for the 2 legs that are worked flat back-and-forth in separate pieces when finishing the waist-line is folded back and seamed from ws the button-bands are worked on front and back of the legs from picked-up and knit sts yarn the leggings are worked using the same yarn as for the sweater details on page 3 of mc natural you will need approximately 70/110/150 m = 80/125/165 yards of cc blue you will need approximately 60/100/140 m = 70/110/155 yards needles a set of dpns size 3 mm/us2 5 or circular needle if working the magic loop to work the waist-band a circular needle 40 cm/16 long size 3 mm/us2 5 to work the main-body 2 dpns straight or circular needle size 3 mm/us2 5 to work the legs notions 8/10/12 buttons 10 mm/0 4 across an elastic ribbon for the waist gauge 30 sts and 38 40 row/rounds in stockinette sts = 10 x 10 cm/4 x 4 read further on page 3 9 cast on starting from the waist-band using mc and the straight or circular needle size 3 mm/us2 5 cast on 120/130/150 sts you may use the long-tail cast-on the old norwegian cast-on or your preferred cast-on method the first 6 row are worked back-and-forth for the inside of the waist-band row 1 rs k all sts row 2 ws p all sts row 3 5 work in stockinette sts as est above row 6 rs the folding line of the waist-band p all sts using the circular needle size 3
